Welcome to GoExpandedWeb’s documentation!¶

GoExpandedWeb repository Notes¶

async scr.repository.notes.create_note(body: NoteModel, user: User, db: Session) → Note¶

The create_note function creates a new note in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – NoteModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user that is logged in

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A note object

Doc-author:

Also

async scr.repository.notes.get_note(note_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Note¶
The get_note function takes in a note_id and user, and returns the Note object with that id.

If no such note exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Specify the note id of the note to be returned

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The note with the given id for the given user

Doc-author:

Also

async scr.repository.notes.get_notes(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Note]¶

The get_notes function returns a list of notes for the given user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a certain number of notes

  • limit – int: Limit the number of notes returned

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of notes for a given user

Doc-author:

Also

async scr.repository.notes.remove_note(note_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶
The remove_note function removes a note from the database.
Args:

note_id (int): The id of the note to be removed. user (User): The user who owns the note to be removed. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and deleting notes.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Specify the note to be deleted

  • user – User: Identify the user who is requesting to remove a note

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The note that was removed

Doc-author:

Also

async scr.repository.notes.update_note(note_id: int, body: NoteUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶
The update_note function updates a note in the database.
Args:

note_id (int): The id of the note to update. body (NoteUpdate): The updated information for the Note object. user (User): The User object that is making this request, used to verify ownership of this Note object.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Identify the note to be deleted

  • body – NoteUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is logged in

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated note if it exists, otherwise none

Doc-author:

Also

async scr.repository.notes.update_status_note(note_id: int, body: NoteStatusUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶

The update_status_note function updates the status of a note in the database.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Find the note in the database

  • body – NoteStatusUpdate: Get the done parameter from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A note object or none if the note does not exist

Doc-author:

Also

GoExpandedWeb repository Tags¶

async scr.repository.tags.create_tag(body: TagModel, user: User, db: Session) → Tag¶

The create_tag function creates a new tag in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – TagModel: Get the name of the tag from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The newly created tag

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.repository.tags.get_tag(tag_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Tag¶

The get_tag function takes in a tag_id and user, and returns the Tag object with that id. If no such tag exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Specify the tag id

  • user – User: Get the user that is making the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A tag object if it exists, otherwise it returns none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.repository.tags.get_tags(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Tag]¶

The get_tags function returns a list of tags for the given user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Set the number of records to skip

  • limit – int: Limit the number of tags returned

  • user – User: Filter the tags by user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of tags

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.repository.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Tag | None¶
The remove_tag function removes a tag from the database.
Args:

tag_id (int): The id of the tag to be removed. user (User): The user who owns the tags being removed. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and deleting data.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Specify the id of the tag to remove

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is authorized to delete the tag

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The tag that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.repository.tags.update_tag(tag_id: int, body: TagModel, user: User, db: Session) → Tag | None¶
The update_tag function updates a tag in the database.
Args:

tag_id (int): The id of the tag to update. body (TagModel): The updated TagModel object with new values for name and color. user (User): The current logged-in user, used to verify that they are authorized to update this item.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Find the tag in the database

  • body – TagModel: Pass the new tag name

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A tag object

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoExpandedWeb repository Users¶

async scr.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object containing the data to be inserted into the database. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy Session object used to interact with our PostgreSQL database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Create a new user object

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Find the user in the database

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter can be a string or none

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user

  • token – str | None: Pass in the token that was received from the spotify api

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoExpandedWeb routes Notes¶

async scr.routes.notes.create_note(body: NoteModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_note function creates a new note in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – NoteModel: Pass the data to create a note

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

:param : Get the note id from the url :return: A note object, which is the same as the body :doc-author: Trelent

async scr.routes.notes.read_note(note_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_note function is used to retrieve a single note from the database. It takes in an integer ID and returns a Note object.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Specify the note id that will be used to retrieve a specific note

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A note object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.routes.notes.read_notes(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_notes function is a GET request that returns all notes in the database. It takes three optional parameters: skip, limit, and db. The skip parameter allows you to specify how many notes to skip before returning results (defaults to 0). The limit parameter allows you to specify how many results should be returned (defaults 100). Finally, the db parameter is used by FastAPI’s dependency injection system for accessing the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n notes

  • limit – int: Limit the number of notes returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of notes, which is the same as the note model

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.routes.notes.remove_note(note_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_note function removes a note from the database.

Parameters:

  • note_id – int: Specify the note to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A note object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.routes.notes.update_note(body: NoteUpdate, note_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_note function updates a note in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – NoteUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • note_id – int: Get the note id from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

Returns:

A note object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.routes.notes.update_status_note(body: NoteStatusUpdate, note_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_status_note function updates the status of a note.

The function takes in a NoteStatusUpdate object, which contains the new status for the note. It also takes in an integer representing the id of the note to be updated and two optional parameters:

  • db: A database session that is used to query data from our database (defaults to Depends(get_db))

  • current_user: An instance of User containing information about our currently logged-in user (defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user))

Parameters:

  • body – NoteStatusUpdate: Get the status of the note

  • note_id – int: Get the note id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A note object with the updated status

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoExpandedWeb routes Tags¶

async scr.routes.tags.create_tag(body: TagModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_tag function creates a new tag in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – TagModel: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the tag id :return: A tag object :doc-author: Trelent

async scr.routes.tags.read_tag(tag_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_tag function is used to retrieve a single tag from the database. It takes in an integer representing the ID of the tag, and returns a Tag object.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Specify the tag id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

:param : Get the tag_id from the url :return: A tag object :doc-author: Trelent

async scr.routes.tags.read_tags(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_tags function returns a list of tags.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of tags returned

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Skip the first n tags :return: A list of tags :doc-author: Trelent

async scr.routes.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_tag function removes a tag from the database.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – int: Pass the tag_id of the tag to be removed

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

:param : Get the id of the tag to be removed :return: A tag object :doc-author: Trelent

async scr.routes.tags.update_tag(body: TagModel, tag_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_tag function updates a tag in the database.

It takes an id, body and db as parameters. The body is a TagModel object that contains the new values for the tag. The function returns an updated TagModel object.

Parameters:

  • body – TagModel: Pass the body of the request to the function

  • tag_id – int: Identify the tag to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

:param : Get the tag id from the url :return: The updated tag, which is the same as the original tag :doc-author: Trelent

GoExpandedWeb routes Users¶

scr.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that returns the current user. It will be used by FastAPI to validate the token and get its associated user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

:param : Get the current user from the database :return: The current user, based on the token :doc-author: Trelent

GoExpandedWeb routes Auth¶

async scr.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular record to

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency injection

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies them against the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with three keys

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access token. The function first decodes the refresh_token to get the email of the user who owns it, then checks if that user exists in our database. If not, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized). If they do exist, we create a new access_token and refresh_token for them using auth_service’s create functions. We update their record in our database with this new information before returning both tokens as well as &quot;bearer&quot; which is just how you tell

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

:param : Get the user’s email from the token :return: A new set of tokens :doc-author: Trelent

async scr.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add tasks to the background task queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async scr.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. If the email address already exists in the database, an HTTP 409 error is raised. The password field of the UserModel object is hashed using Argon2 and stored in that form. A new user record is created with this information and returned to the client.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the request body and validate it against the usermodel schema

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the user and a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoExpandedWeb service Auth¶

class scr.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds,

the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 90 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id, username, and email

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the user’s information

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that is sent to the server

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object that is associated with the jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our secret key and algorithm, then returning the sub (subject) field of the payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password to be hashed into the function

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method callable on an instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with the hashed version of

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

GoExpandedWeb service Email¶

async scr.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that users can click on within their emails.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user

  • username – str: Personalize the email message

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
